thread.title: Floyd Mayweather addresses superfight report in statement Conor McGregor - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Floyd Mayweather addresses superfight report in statement Conor McGregor - Yahoo7

author: Aap On February
title: Floyd Mayweather addresses superfight report in statement Conor McGregor - Yahoo7
text:
Share Floyd Mayweather addresses superfight report in statement Conor McGregor - Yahoo7 Retired boxing superstar Floyd Mayweather has responded to numerous reports that he has agreed to a fight with Conor McGregor. Close Conor McGregor back in the boxing ring UP NEXT VIDEO Conor McGregor back in the boxing ring. Source: Conor McGregor Conor McGregor back in the boxing ring 
A report in the Irish Sun indicated the pair had already agreed to terms for the fight, while Mayweather was quoted as telling ESPN's Stephen A Smith that the fight was "very, very close". 
However Mayweather seemed to distance himself from those reports in a statement posted to Twitter 
“There seems to be several rumours floating around media recently however let the record show, there hasn’t been any deals made in regards to a fight between myself and any other fighters,” Mayweather wrote. 
"I am happily retired and enjoying life at this time. If any changes are to come, be sure that I will be the first to let the world know." — Floyd Mayweather (@FloydMayweather) February 14, 2017 
"Real people are having real discussions," Nevada State Athletic Commission chairman Anthony Marnell told ESPN on Tuesday, "I'm also telling you my opinion as the NSAC chairman that a lot of things need to get done in order to see something like this come together because there are so many parties that want to get their hands on the pot. 
"Maybe it will get figured out, but it's going to be hard when everyone is declaring they want $US100 million ($A131 million)." The big fight is getting closer. Pic: Getty 
Earlier, Yahoo Sports boxing reporter Chris Mannix declared the fight was still a long way off after being told a report from the Irish Sun was off the mark. 
"No truth to the overseas report of a Mayweather-McGregor deal, per source directly involved in the process," Mannix tweeted. 
"From what I'm told, this is Conor McGregor putting pressure on (UFC boss) Dana White. Far more likely McGregor takes a lucrative MMA fight next." Close Mayweather's massive call on McGregor fight UP NEXT VIDEO Mayweather's massive call on McGregor fight. Source: Sky Sports Mayweather's massive call on McGregor fight 
Mayweather, a former five-division boxing champion who retired undefeated at 49-0 in 2015, said in January he believed the fight could happen after McGregor said he was determined to fight him. 
The 28-year-old McGregor, the reigning UFC Lightweight Champion, obtained his California boxing licence in December. 
UFC president Dana White offered McGregor and Mayweather a sum of $25 million each in January for a fight. Mayweather scoffed at the offer, saying White was "an (expletive) comedian." Close UFC boss makes offer for Mayweather to fight McGregor UP NEXT VIDEO UFC boss makes offer for Mayweather to fight McGregor: Colin Cowherd UFC boss makes offer for Mayweather to fight McGregor 
McGregor last competed at UFC 205 last November when he beat Eddie Alvarez for the lightweight title to become the first two-division champion in UFC history. 
He also held the featherweight title after knocking out Jose Aldo at UFC 200 last July. McGregor was stripped of the featherweight belt in November to focus on the lightweight division. 
McGregor, 21-3 in MMA competition, is not scheduled to compete in a UFC event until May to avoid putting unnecessary stress on partner Dee Devlin, who is pregnant with the couple's first child.
